**Wikipedia summary**:  
<p class="mw-empty-elt">
</p>

<p>The <b>red sea urchin</b> (<i><b>Mesocentrotus franciscanus</b></i>) is a sea urchin found in the northeastern Pacific Ocean from Alaska to Baja California. It lives in shallow waters from the low-tide line to greater than 280&#160;m (920&#160;ft) deep, and is typically found on rocky shores sheltered from extreme wave action in areas where kelp is available.
